text:
14-30 Cooper Square, west side, north from but not including East 4th Street, to but not including Astor Place.

January 10, 1928.

Edwin Levick.
title: Manhattan: Cooper Square (North) - 4th Street.

text:
(1)
Cooper Square, north from East 4th Street, showing Fourth and Third Aves. converging to form at their apex, the Bowery. Surface cars from both lines are seen in the foreground with the Third Ave. Elevated overhead. In the center appears the Cooper Union Institute, founded by Peter Cooper.
February 24, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a closer view of the Cooper Union Institute.
July 7, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, north from E. 5th Street.
Sept. 20, 1935

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Cooper Square (North) - 4th Street (East) - [Cooper Union Institute.]
Tenements and storefronts; Jack Nagel Heating & Plumbing: 41 E. 4th St. - Bowery - 2nd Ave., Manhattan

text:
Cooper Square, north from E. 4th Street. In the center is Cooper Union Institute with a small triangular park preceding same. At this point begins two of Manhattans important thorough fares, Fourth Ave. (left) & 3rd Ave. (right), which emanate from the Bowery.

February 4, 1937

W.P.A. Photo.
Five Boroughs Project,
title: Manhattan: Cooper Square (North) - 4th Street (East).
